result.execSummary:
The defendant David D. Stowell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.  Drug Purchase Money in the amount of $90.00 ordered repaid on a Joint and Several basis with the co-defendant, Belinda Dassow.
Huber Privileges and Good Time Credit granted.
No DNA sample ordered as Defendant previously provided the same through another felony conviction.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David D. Stowell

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 10:50 AM: Defendant David D. Stowell in court with attorney Katherine Seifert.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per Atty Seifert - resolution reached and recited.  Def and ADA confirm recital.  Terms of bifurcated SEH explained.    Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea Ct 1 w/PTAC:  NC  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Statement by Def:  None offered.  Def confirms he declines probation.  The Court:   8 mos WCJ, direct sentence, Huber, GT and No TS credit; Report 9/1/2016 at 8:00 PM; Court Costs - 60 DTP or PP plus $90 purchase money on a J/S basis; DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice.  Def believes that he gave a sample previously through Marquette Co.  Def advised of Firearm Prohibition and Voting Ineligibility - NC plea reaffirmed.  Appeal Rights Given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 19, 2016 at 10:30 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Katherine Seifert in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Seifert requests plea/sentencing date about 45 days out.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 19, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Status conference on May 24, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Status conference on May 13, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Katherine Seifert in court appears telephonically.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Seifert requesting another STC.  Status conference scheduled for May 13, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Defendant's Motion for Discovery and Inspection
Defendant's Written Waiver of Preliminary Examination

Case Called @ 1:35 PM: Defendant David D. Stowell in court with attorney Katherine Seifert.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Preliminary Hearing and Time Limits discussed. Defendant wishes to waive preliminary hearing in its entirety.  Written waiver provided by counsel.   Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of preliminary hearing.  Def BOT.  INFO Filed - Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  NGP received and entered.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for April 1, 2016 at 03:10 pm.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department.

3:55 pm case called. Defendant David D. Stowell in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint stated. Confirmed receipt. Court addresses counsel. Defendant has retained counsel and will be meeting with the attorney on February 16, 2016. Court directs the defendant to contact SPD. Riverside ruling in favor of the State  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 1, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
